abstract: A protocol for defining a constraint on the value of a certain attribute.
overview:
## Overview

Used as an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AttributedTextFormattingDefinition], this constrains the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AttributedTextValueConstraint/AttributeKey]’s value using the `constrain(_:)-(Attributes)` function.

Given value constraints can read other attribute values, it is crucial to avoid mixing value constraints in a way where they create cyclic dependencies with undefined behavior. Thus, it is recommended to think about value constraints in the context of the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AttributedTextFormattingDefinition] they will be used in:

A simple constraint only accesses a single attribute. It can be made generic over the attribute scope so it can be reused in different [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AttributedTextFormattingDefinition]s.

When the constraint needs to access other attribute values, it is recommended to define it on a specific attribute scope that is used for a single [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AttributedTextFormattingDefinition].

Constraints that access multiple attributes and are generic over the scope should document their dependencies so that the dependencies can be considered for the ordering of constraints in the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AttributedTextFormattingDefinition/body-1b01t].
